item.title: Broken fence panel(s), 7th December
item.description:
One or more of the fence panels that are mostly hidden by thick shrubbery were partially damaged by high gusts of winds some time ago but, now, overnight, a section of the fence has gone down completely and a bigger gap has opened up within it than there was, previously. If this issue is not resolved, the gap will, probably, quickly morph into a de facto passageway between the Thames Path and the street. Access to the Thames Path from the street is normally through a gated entrance about forty-five meters to the east from where this new gap has opened up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lytham Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dip in lane getting bigger weekly, 7th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bunkers Hill, North Cray, Greater London

item.title: How can we get this bin removed?, 7th December
item.description:
